subject: Re: [junit] While writing ejb test clients..
msgSnippet: Yes Jason is correct . One time set up is what I m looking for. But TestSetup will not solve my problem. As it is explained , it will do the setup and teardown

Yes Jason is correct . One time set up is what I'm looking for. But
TestSetup will not solve my problem. As it is explained , it will do
the setup and teardown once for the TestSuite . But my requirement is
ontime setup for each TestCase (which will have more than one
testmethod) . So the way around what i can think now is , I can make
individual test as testSuite and implement this.And consodilating these
suites into a master TestSuite.
I there any issues with this approach.

-Karthik



 --- Jason Rogers <jacaetevha@...> wrote: > On Tue, 13 Jan
2004 13:06:20 -0500, J. B. Rainsberger
> <jbrains@...> 
> wrote:
> 
> > karthikeyand wrote:
> >
> >> Hi,
> >>    while writing tests for testing EJB code , for eg., we need to
> >> insert some rows (thru entity ejb) and test the creation ,
> >> relationships etc., but before exiting the testcase i need to
> remove
> >> the new rows (or entity objects) entered before executing the test
> >> case .So the creation of the rows and removing the rows are done
> only
> >> once in the test case which might contain many testXXX() methods.
> So
> >> is there a standard approach for the above said scenario.
> >
> > This is exactly what tearDown() is for: to "tear down" your test
> > fixture. In general, whatever you do in setUp(), you do the
> opposite in
> > tearDown().
> 
> Sounds like <karthikeyand> is talking about the need for a one-time 
> setup.  If that be so, please search the archives or JUnit
> documentation 
> for TestSetup.  It takes care of one-time operations.
> 
> =jason
>
